data.question: What type of ligands are described as highly inert in uranyl compounds?
In what year was the reaction involving concurrent single-electron reduction and oxo-group silylation of the uranyl dication reported?
What is the unique feature of the binuclear uranium(V) dioxo complex A?
data.answer: It features one mutually trans and one mutually cis oxo ligand within a U2O2 core, as well as two silylated exo-oxo groups.

data.question: What happens to uranyl(V) complexes upon exposure to air?
data.answer: They decompose either by oxidation or proton-coupled disproportionation reactions.

data.question: How can the silyl groups be removed from the complexes, according to the text?
data.answer: By a method that reinstates oxo yl character, leading to the rearrangement of the cis/trans-oxo motif back to the traditional linear uranyl geometry.

data.question: What is the result of the two-electron oxidation of the desilylated complex 2 c with pyridine-N-oxide?
data.answer: Formation of the doubly desilylated, binuclear UV compound K2-[(OUO)2(L)] (2) and half an equivalent of (Me3Si)2O.

data.question: True or False: The oxo-silylated complexes are unstable under anaerobic conditions.
True or False: The binuclear uranium(V) dioxo complex A is derived from two cis-uranyl dications.
True or False: The exposure of a THF or pyridine solution of 2 c to dioxygen results in instantaneous oxidation to form the binuclear UVI peroxide K2[(m-k2-k2-O2)-(UO2)2(L)] (3).
What is the yield of [K(thf)2([18]crown-6)]2[(Me3SiOUO)2(L)] (1 b) when solvate 1 a is treated with two equivalents of [18]crown-6?
What is the outcome of reoxidation of either 1 a or 1 b with single equivalents of iodine?
data.answer: Clean reformation of A with elimination of potassium iodide.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of the binuclear uranium(V) dioxo complex A demonstrates the ability to manipulate uranyl oxo group bonding and reactivity through control of the uranium oxidation state and oxo-group functionalization.
True or False: The desilylated complex 2 c is less reactive towards oxidation compared to its silylated analogue A.
What is the structural difference between complexes 3 and 4?
data.answer: Complex 3 contains a bridging peroxide ligand, while complex 4 contains a single oxide ligand bridging the uranium centers.

data.question: True or False: The trialkylsilyl group in complex A acts as an effective protecting group for the uranyl oxo, contributing to its remarkable redox stability.
What is the yield of the binuclear UVI peroxide K2[(m-k2-k2-O2)-(UO2)2(L)] (3) upon oxidation?
True or False: The desilylated complex 2 c can be transformed back to A using common reagents such as fluoride.
What is the role of the Schiff base polypyrrolic macrocycle L in the chemistry of the uranyl cation?
data.answer: It complexes a single uranyl cation in a Pacman-shaped cleft structure, facilitating single-electron reduction and oxo-group silylation.

data.question: What is the significance of the UVI/V redox couple in the context of the described research?
data.answer: It can be exploited to carry out the two-electron reduction of dioxygen to peroxide.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis and characterization of the described complexes do not provide insight into the nature and stability of the binuclear UV precursors A and 2 c.
